tn.ref: Yahweh sold them into the hand of Jabin king of Canaan
tn.text: Here "hand" refers to Jabin's power over Israel. Yahweh's decision to give Jabin power over them is spoken of as if Yahweh had sold them to Jabin. AT: "Yahweh allowed them to be defeated by the power of Jabin king of Canaan" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: the road on which you are going will not lead to your honor
tn.text: The choice Barak makes is spoken of as if Barak were choosing a road on which to travel. And, "honor" is spoken of as if it were a destination to which one travels. AT: "no one will honor you for what you do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.text: Here "hand" refers to her power to kill him. AT: "for Yahweh will cause a woman to defeat Sisera" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.text: God causing the Israelites to defeat Jabin and his army is spoken of as is God himself defeated Jabin as the people of Israel watched. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
